oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Lester Colored School and Church

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Rural schools; Segregation; Churches; Bell towers
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wooden church building used as an African-American school. In the front corner is a bell tower.
The African American scholastic population of Haywood County in 1924-1925 was 4,970.
